page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT IN AVERHAM
page.content: Employment in Averham consists mainly of farming,with some gardening and woodworking.Farmers employ cowmen, tractor drivers,maintenance workers and casual labour for crop collection. A local man is a gardener.A woodworker makes furniture.Retired people do part time jobs,such as running a talking newspaper for the blind and others. Many people are commuters and travel to office jobs at Kelham Hall,to British Gypsum at Newark and Staunton as executive and manual staff.Shift workers travel to Staythorpe Power Station.Some people are teachers and lecturers.They travel to Newark, Nottingham and Leicester.There is no unemployment and a few people move from the area because of promotion. Young people have to find employment away from the village due to lack of opportunity in the area.
